text: Prepare a 9x9 pan by covering it with aluminum foil and spraying the foil with nonstick cooking spray.  Roughly chop or crumble 6 sandwich cookies and set them aside. Thinly chop the remaining sandwich cookies with a sharp knife or a food processor until the mixture looks like small crumbs. In a medium saucepan, intermix the sugar, butter, and evaporated milk. Apply to medium-high heat and whisk the mixture while the mixture comes to a full boil. Continue to boil, stirring constantly, for exactly three minutes. Detach the pan from the heat and at once stir in the white chocolate chips, marshmallow cream, vanilla, and the finely crushed cookie crumbs. Beat until the chocolate is liquefied and the fudge is smooth and well-combined. Drizzle the crudely chopped cookies over the top of the fudge and churn them into the fudge with a few turns of a butter knife. Do not swirl too much or else they will disappear from the top of the fudge. Place in the refrigerator until the fudge is set, about 2 hours (or overnight at room temperature). To serve, cut into 1-inch squares. Finished.
